item.title: Zarate welcomes EU call for probe on 'extrajudicial killings' in Philippines
item.description: Bayan Muna party-list Representative Carlos Zarate welcomed the call of the European (EU) Parliament for an independent investigation into the "extrajudicial killings" in the country involving activists.

item.title: Thai protesters challenge monarchy as huge protests escalate
item.description: Openly challenging the monarchy of Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn, thousands of protesters marched in Bangkok on Sunday to present demands that include a call for reforms to curb his powers.

item.title: PNPA's COVID cases climb to 243; at least 359 contacts under quarantine
item.description: The total number of COVID-19 cases at the Philippine National Police Academy climbed to 243 from 232 after testing all cadets and personnel, its director Police Major General Gilbert Cruz said on Sunday.

item.title: Egrets drop by Manila Bay during 'White Sands' project opening
item.description: A flock of migratory egrets dropped by during the Manila Bay "White Sands" project's opening on Sunday, as if drawn in by the fuss over the beach area spruce-up.

item.title: Cayetano to still win by 'landslide' if House holds another election for speakership --Barzaga
item.description: Cavite Representative Elpidio Barzaga Jr. believes that Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano would still win by "landslide" if the House of Representatives will hold another election for the speakership.

item.title: CHED withholds reimbursements for some schools over compliance issues
item.description: Some Schools' reimbursements under the Free Higher Education (FHE) program have been withheld for their failure to comply with some requirements, the Commission on Higher Education said.

item.title: Zubiri sees swift Senate approval of measure raising age of statutory rape
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel "Migz" Zubiri is optimistic that the measure seeking to raise the age of statutory rape to 16 years old will be quickly approved in the Senate, considering the groundswell of support among his fellow senators.

item.title: Philippines must seize chance to speak up vs. China -former envoy
item.description: Manila should speak up and take action over its claims in the West Philippines Sea after some European states at United Nations expressed their support for the 2016 arbitral victory against Beijing, a former envoy said.

item.title: 10-anyos na batang babae sa Antique nagtala ng 17.3 meters 'dolphin dive'
item.description: PANDAN, Antique --Isang 10-anyos na batang babae ang nakapagtala ng record na 17.3 meters na diving sa kalagitnaan ng karagatan ng Pandan Bay.

item.title: Envelope with deadly poison ricin addressed to White House intercepted
item.description: An envelope addressed to the White House and intercepted by US authorities contained a substance identified as ricin, a deadly poison that appeared to have been sent from Canada, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said on Saturday.

item.title: No reason to be duly concerned about EU Parliament call to revoke tariff exemption --Baja
item.description: The Philippines should not be duly concerned about the European Union Parliament's call for the revocation of the country's exports tariff exemption, former Philippine Permanent Representative to the United Nations Lauro Baja said on Sunday.

item.title: Worldwide coronavirus cases reach 30.55 million, death toll at 951,051 --Reuters tally
item.description: More than 30.55 million people have been reported to be infected by the novel coronavirus globally and 951,051 have died, according to a Reuters tally.

item.title: Security forces discover bomb in Jolo, Sulu
item.description: State forces prevented an attack in Jolo, Sulu after discovering an explosive on Saturday, the Armed Forces of the Philippines Western Mindanao Command said on Sunday.

item.title: Trump will nominate a woman next week to succeed Ginsburg on Supreme Court
item.description: President Donald Trump on Saturday he will nominate a woman to sit on the US Supreme Court, a move that tip the court further to the right following the death of liberal Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

item.title: Manila Bay Sands draws crowds; social distancing a challenge
item.description: People flocked to Roxas Boulevard in Manila before sunrise on Sunday as many hoped to experience walking on Manila Bay Sands, the "white sand" portion of Baywalk.
